Legacy Email Scope: Agency is still determining the full scope of our legacy email.  It dates back to sometime before 2001.  We will report our full finding to NARA within 6 months.

OIG will include legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2002 for Capstone officials, and for non-Capstone officials dating back approximately 7 years from the effective date of this schedule.

Agency will be including legacy email dating back to 2013, as the email journaling policy defined in the Army Regulation 25-400-2 Army Records Information Management System in place prior to Capstone.
The Bureau will be including legacy email for items 010 and 011, dating back to approximately 2000.  Earlier emails were printed and filed.

SSA operated under a print-and-file policy prior to the implementation of Capstone.  Some legacy email, however, exists for some positions, including those under item 010.  The dates vary, with the earliest dating back to approximately 1997.
Agency will be including legacy e-mail for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2000.

Departmental Offices will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to 2001.  Agency is still determining the full scope of our legacy email.  It dates back to sometime before 2001.  We will report our full finding to NARA within 6 months.

A traditional records management approach with a print-to-file policy was enforced prior to Capstone adoption, as well as use of other disposition authorities to capture email. Some legacy email, however, exists; the scope of legacy email varies by position with the earliest date being 1999.
Legacy email is not included in the Capstone categorization, as traditional records management with a print-and-file policy was followed prior to Capstone adoption.

The capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented Proof point. Prior to 2011, USDA employed a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Disposition Authority.
Agency will be including legacy email for item 010, dating back to approximately 2012
CDC will be including legacy emails dating back to October 2014, that were retained by each executive in their email account.

Up to approximately 180 days prior to Capstone implementation, disposition for individual legacy emails is carried out according to their subject content, consistent with the approved DeCA retentions.  Legacy emails starting approximately 180 days prior to Capstone implementation will be covered by the Capstone GRS schedule.

Agency will be including legacy email dating back to 2013, as the email journaling policy defined in the Army Regulation 25-400-2 Army Records Information Management System was in place prior to Capstone.
USADF will include legacy emails dating back to 2013.

In the majority of cases, no legacy email exists because print-and-file policy was previously utilized; where available, legacy email for certain Commissioners will be included (dating back to early 2016).
Extant legacy email prior to 2007 is not suitable for the Capstone approach and EPA plans to submit a separate Request for Disposition Authority for disposal.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2010

The capstone approach will be applied to all legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented ProofPoiint. Prior to 2011, USDA applied a print and file policy to emails. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Records Disposition Authority.

Agency will be including legacy email dating back to 2013, as the email journaling policy defined in the Army Regulation 25-400 Army Records Information Management System was in place prior to Capstone.

Limited legacy email exists for this agency, as traditional records management with print and file policy was enforced prior to capstone adaption.  Also, HHS has captured all SES/Political email accounts since Nov 2014. All legacy email in the employees mailbox at that time was retained.

NARA adopted the Capstone approach on 23 January 2013 with the transition to Gmail. Application of this GRS will also include any available legacy email migrated from the previous email platform (Groupwise) to the current system.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2010.

The Capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented ProofPoint. Prior to 2011, USDA applied a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Disposal Authority.
Agency has a print-and-file policy which was enforced prior to Capstone adoption and intend to implement Capstone in 2016.
No legacy email exists for this agency, as traditional records management with a print-and-file policy was enforced prior to Capstone adoption.
No legacy e-mail exists for this agency, as legacy emails were migrated to the individual email accounts.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used dating back to approximately 2012.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used dating back to approximately 2011.

The Capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and it's components implemented ProofPoint. Prior to 2011, USDA applied a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior t o2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Records Disposition Authority.
The Bureau will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2010.

Email capture will be "point-forward" upon approval of this NA-1005 by NARA.  Estimated implementation date 01/01/2017.  The legacy process for email was print-to-file and will be in place until full Capstone implementation.
NIH will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to at least December 2014. Additional emails available prior to December 2014 will also be included.
No legacy email exists for this agency, as traditional records management with print-and-file policy was enforced prior to Capstone adoption.

The capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented Proof Point. Prior to 2011, USDA employed a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Disposition Authority.
General Services Administration will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately October 1, 2011.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2010. Previous to 2010, traditional records management with a print-and-file policy was enforced.
No legacy email exists for this agency.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2000.
Agency will be including legacy e-mail for all items dating back to 2010.  Prior to 2010 the agency policy was to print and file.

NGA has legacy email for the top 6 agency officials dating back to 2010.  NGA has the legacy email for all other Capstone Officials who held or currently serve in Capstone positions from June 2016 forward.  The majority of all Capstone Official email is August 2016 forward.  NGA also has legacy email for a limited number of Non-Capstone user accounts going back to 2010.

The capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented ProofPoint. Prior to 2011, USDA applied a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Disposition Authority.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2005

The capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented Proof point. Prior to 2011, USDA employed a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal of a separate Request for Disposition Authority.
Agency will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2009.
Legacy emails prior to the July 2014 email transition to the Defense Enterprise Email, are archived and stored on a backup tape pending disposition in accordance with GRS 3.2 Item 41.

NEH will implement the Capstone policy here on a day-forward basis from the approval of this form NA-1005. NEH will transfer legacy email, dating back to approximately 2009. Prior to 2009, NEH implemented a print and file policy.
CNCS plans on including legacy emails for individuals in documented Capstone positions going back to approximately 2007, for as many email accounts that are available in CNCS back-up tapes/drives.

The SEC identified and archived existing email accounts of departed staff who map to Capstone designated positions. These accounts are managed in the SEC’s Enterprise Vault. In addition, legacy Capstone email messages are associated with case/project files in both paper and electronic formats per the SEC’s previous records management policies.Pre-2008 email messages were captured via print-to-file processes in compliance with SEC’s previous email management policy.
The Office of the Secretary will be including legacy email dating back to approximately December 1, 2014.
The Office of the Assistant Secretary for Health will be including legacy email dating back to approximately December 1, 2014.

The Department will be applying GRS 6.1 item 010 and item 011 beginning on December 31, 2016 and continuing day forward for all emails. Pursuant to question 22, section A in the aforementioned FAQ guidance, the Department will also be using GRS 23, item 7 as part of its culling strategy. The Department will be applying GRS 6.1, item 010 to any existing legacy senior official’s emails, including its email collection that was previously maintained on disc commonly referred to as Cable Archive Retrieval System. This reflects the Department’s effort to ensure as much permanently valuable email will be transferred to NARA as possible. The Department will not be applying GRS 6.1, item 011 or item 012 for temporary legacy emails created before December 31, 2016. The Department will be applying its other approved disposition authorities for these records pursuant to question 22, section B in the aforementioned FAQ.  Please note, the Department routinely communicated with its employees concerning their records management responsibilities through Cables and Department Notices which required each employee to print-and-file and/or cross-file email records.

Prior to Capstone, CMS has a print-and-file policy for email.  CMS is currently researching the level of legacy email that exists, and will include it in Capstone implementation. As an example, CMS has email of the Administrator back to approximately 2009.
The Library will be including legacy e-mail for all account holders dating back to approximately 2010.  Prior to 2010 the Library incorporated a print and file policy for email.
The Department of Education will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately January 2009.
MSPB will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to 2015.
No legacy email exists at OPM, as traditional records management with print-and-file was the policy prior to Capstone adoption.

The capstone approach will be applied to all legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented ProofPoint. Prior to 2011, USDA employed a print and file policy to email.  Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Records Disposition Authority.

The Capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented ProofPoint. Prior to 2011, USDA applied a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Disposition Authority.

Agency will be including electronic email for the Chairman James H. Lambright 2006-2009 and electronic email for the Chairman Fred Hochberg 2009-present.  Other permanent record e-mail from the time period predating 2014 is in paper format, as traditional records management with a print-and-file policy was enforced prior to 2014 adoption of the media-neutral Records Schedule  DAA-0275-2015-0001 by the agency.

TTB will apply the Capstone approach to email records management (GRS 6.1) retrospectively to all available legacy email.  TTB has some permanent email from accounts that pre-date 2003 that were active at the time of re-organization, which originated with TTB's predecessor organization within the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF).  Email from accounts inactive at the time of re-organization were not transferred to TTB.  ATF is responsible for managing these records.  Also, pre-dated 2003 printed email records are maintained in respective industry/case file disposed as per record schedule.

The capstone approach will be applied to legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented ProofPoint. Prior  to 2011, USDA applied a print and file policy to email. Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled on a separate Request for Records Disposition Authority.
DOL will adopt the Capstone approach on December 31, 2016 or upon approval, whichever is later.  Application of this GRS will also include any available legacy email.
Agency will be including legacy email for Item 10, dating back to approximately 2008.

The department does not maintain electronic mail in an electronic record keeping system.  Prior to adopting the Capstone approach, Federal records created or received by electronic mail are printed and filed in a traditional/manual record keeping system.
FinCEN will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately 2013. All prior email was managed using traditional (print-and-file) records management approaches.
HRSA will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to approximately December 2015.
